Step.name: # (comment)
Step.Text: Send a Request To an API EndPoint

Step.name: # (comment)
Step.Text: success means the server responded. It still may respond with "Bad Request"

Step.name: # (comment)
Step.Text: @param {string} request.url the url to send the request to

Step.name: # (comment)
Step.Text: @param {object} [request.query] name value pairs in JSON that serialize to what comes after the "?" in the url. For nested querystrings you can use "|_" and "_|" for "[" and "]". Ex. customer[name] would be customer|_name_|

Step.name: # (comment)
Step.Text: @param {object} [request.headers] value pairs to set the headers example {"Accept" ; "application/json" }

Step.name: # (comment)
Step.Text: @param {string} [request.data] the data to send only with POST, PUT, PATCH, For nested application/x-www-form-urlencoded data you can use "|_" and "_|" for "[" and "]". Ex. customer[name] would be customer|_name_|

Step.name: # (comment)
Step.Text: @returnSuccess {object} response.trace the request trace - if options.trace = true

Step.name: # (comment)
Step.Text: @returnSuccess {object} response.duration the request duration - if options.duration = true

Step.name: # (comment)
Step.Text: @history v1.5 major refactor 11/12/2018 - todd@geistinteractive.com - based on Generator 1 version

Step.name: # (comment)
Step.Text: @history v1.6 handles binary, and form data, also handles 100 status codes

Step.name: # (comment)
Step.Text: @history v1.6.2 fixes empty headers bug for real

Step.name: # (comment)
Step.Text: @history v1.6.4 fixes basic auth space in user name issue

Step.name: # (comment)
Step.Text: @history v1.7.0 adds nested form fields using application/x-www-form-urlencoded

Step.name: # (comment)
Step.Text: @history v1.8.0 adds options for trace and duration

Step.name: # (comment)
Step.Text: there are 3 ways to pass the container data as JSON, base64 is MUCH slower than the others on large files

Step.name: # (comment)
Step.Text: some API need ordered properties, since most JSON parsers can't guarentee that, we need to treat it as string
